stream_context.summary: Kaze imports and integrates several new assets supplied by Biobak (seller-shy-guy, speed rings, airplane, factory platforms), debugs multiple issues (missing floor, warp size, broken propeller, texture combiners, sound distance bug), fine-tunes gameplay in a factory level—most visibly a plane mini-game and a collapsing-platform hallway—and reviews pending animation work from Zeina.

development_findings.summary: Old Nintendo exporter duplicated animated bones; Kaze removed the GeoBone workaround and properly fixes it, eliminating one matrix multiplication per actor.
development_findings.quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

development_findings.summary: Warp objects now carry extra parameters for camera settings; a recent change shrank all their hitboxes, so Kaze must manually enlarge them.
development_findings.quote: The warps are all too small right now because I had to change something about the warps.

development_findings.summary: Actors far from the camera occasionally report a zero position, causing their sounds to play at full volume; Kaze flags this as a systemic audio bug.
development_findings.quote: One actor can be so far away from the camera that it doesn't update its position … the sound plays as though it was right on top of the camera.

development_findings.summary: The airplane’s propeller texture was missing; Kaze rebuilt it, chose IA8 over IA4 for finer grayscale, and re-clamped the texture to stop wrapping artifacts.
development_findings.quote: IA8’s really good … you get more detail when you use IA8.

development_findings.summary: New dust-trail texture for the plane mini-game broke the length-by-speed effect; after testing a Biobak revision Kaze reverted to the previous combiner that works.
development_findings.quote: Honestly I think I might just bring the old system back just because this actually works for me right now.

development_findings.summary: Collapsing platforms now detect Mario’s speed; if he is sprinting they drop instantly, creating spectacle without increasing failure rate.
development_findings.quote: It makes the section feel a lot more intense without actually making it more difficult.

development_findings.summary: Random-rock spawner in the plane course only shows one model; Kaze discovers the definitions for four variants are broken and notes it for later repair.
development_findings.quote: Apparently there were four variations actually … this was broken.

development_findings.summary: Zeina’s penguin and Dory animations are required before Course 4 testing can continue; legacy actors still rely on the outdated GeoBone system.
development_findings.quote: All the actors in this model are fucked up animation-wise because they still use the old geo bones system.

development_findings.summary: Mini N64 Object Exporter plug-in stopped exporting animation frames in the latest Blender build; Kaze falls back to copying data manually.
development_findings.quote: I think it’s the new Blender version that broke it … there’s only one solution and that solution fucking sucks but I can do it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans to fill factory corridors with pipes and metal walls, then cull overdraw; UV-mapped placeholder geometry is already in place.
development_findings.quote: I want pipes everywhere … I will still kill the overdraw.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritises efficiency in life and design (cuts his own hair; reduces difficulty if it doesn’t add purpose).
He recently upgraded to a G502 mouse, discovering 40 ms less input lag and blaming old hardware for poor shooter performance.
context_findings.quote: My mouse was the reason I was completely unable to play shooter games.

context_findings.summary: Marketing plan: use RTYI’s launch to kick-start a new original IP via Kickstarter and hire additional staff.
context_findings.quote: Half a year before Return to Yoshi's Island releases we are gonna announce our own game project … and then I can hire a bunch of people.

context_findings.summary: Kaze sees Twitter mainly as a preview/marketing tool; surprised to have 32 k followers and intends to leverage it for release.
context_findings.quote: I don’t think I deserve my Twitter followers … maybe I should start ramping up Twitter advertisement when the game gets closer to release.

context_findings.summary: Open to multiple language localisations; mentions Biobak and Rionno as professional translators.
context_findings.quote: We’ll probably also have like a French version and a Spanish version because … are professionally educated game translators.

context_findings.summary: Avoids showing NDA content on stream, indicating legal awareness.
context_findings.quote: Uh-oh, I can’t be opening Unreal Engine on stream … almost broke NDA.

biobak.summary: Provided several new assets: Seller Shy Guy model, speed rings, airplane remodel with updated textures, random rock variations, factory platform textures.
biobak.quote: Considering we have to import a bunch of shit for Biobak let's do that.

biobak.summary: Gives gameplay feedback, suggesting instant platform collapse and visual tweaks to plane trail.
biobak.quote: It would feel cool to see them fall behind them.

zeina.summary: Responsible for new penguin animations (and Dory); progress blocks some course testing.
zeina.quote: All the penguins need animations Zeina and Dory.

zeina.summary: Personal note: cut Kaze’s hair and visited the house mid-stream with her brother.
zeina.quote: Zaina cut my hair … never mind, it's Zaina and her brother.

key_stories.title: Killing GeoBone
key_stories.summary: Legacy Nintendo exporter duplicated bones, wasting processing time. Kaze decides to remove the GeoBone workaround and implement a proper fix.
key_stories.challenge: Extra matrices per actor due to duplicated animated bones.
key_stories.process: Explained the historical bug, removed GeoBone references, and rebuilt actors.
key_stories.outcome: Saves one matrix multiplication for every animated model, improving performance.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

key_stories.title: Plane Mini-game Texture Debacle
key_stories.summary: New dust-trail texture from Biobak didn’t scale with speed, looking broken. Kaze compared combiners, tried edits, and ultimately reverted.
key_stories.challenge: Dust trail no longer lengthened with plane speed after asset swap.
key_stories.process: Tested Biobak’s IA-8 texture, experimented with combiner maths, identified underflow, restored previous setup.
key_stories.outcome: Mini-game visuals back to intended behaviour; old combiner retained.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I prefer this … I might just bring the old system back.

key_stories.title: Designing Exciting but Easy Collapsing Platforms
key_stories.summary: Factory corridor needed flair without punishing players. Kaze adjusts behaviour so platforms collapse instantly only when Mario sprints.
key_stories.challenge: Make set-piece thrilling without raising difficulty in late-section hallway.
key_stories.process: Added speed check in code; tuned timing and layout; moved some platforms lower and added boxes for readability.
key_stories.outcome: Sequence now feels dramatic while remaining accessible.
key_stories.key_quote: It makes the section feel a lot more intense without actually making it more difficult.

open_questions.context: Kaze notices some actors report zero distance and play at full volume.
questions: What is causing the position update to fail?
How widespread is the issue across levels?

open_questions.context: Kaze plans a Kickstarter tied to RTYI’s release but shared no specifics.
questions: What genre and scope is the new IP?
How will the team transition from ROM-hack to commercial game?
What roles does Kaze want to hire for?

open_questions.context: Kaze is unsure whether to add Banjo-Tooie–style in-world links.
questions: Has a final decision been made?
If yes, what technical approach will be used?
How will this affect pacing and level design?

open_questions.context: Testing of Course 4 and other areas is blocked until Zeina finishes animations.
questions: What is the current animation pipeline?
Will old GeoBone actors be fully converted?

open_questions.context: Spawner shows only one model despite definitions for four.
questions: What broke in the object definition?
Is this linked to recent optimization work?
Who will repair and test the variations?
